NYC Mesh
Map Blog Meetup

A community-owned
resilient network.

New Node Request

What is a mesh?

A mesh network consists of Wi-Fi router "nodes" spread throughout the city. The network has no central server and no single internet service provider. All nodes cooperate in the distribution of data, serving as a stand-alone network in case of emergencies.

Our mission

We aim to create a free, resilient, stand-alone communication system that serves both for daily use and also for emergencies—be it power outages or internet disruption—running software that helps our community with hyperlocal maps and events.

Get involved

  • Install a node

    Our network grows stronger with each new node, so if you are located in NYC let us know.

    It's all about installing a router, starting at $22. We help install and configure it for you.

    There are no monthly fees and you'll help us grow.

    Request New Node

  • Meetups

    We meet in downtown Manhattan. People from all backgrounds are welcome.

    Join us on Meetup

    Newsletter

    Be informed of our progress via email.

    Join our Newsletter

  • Donate

    NYC Mesh is a labor of love and all members are unpaid volunteers, but we're always in need of new hardware.

    If you can afford to help, please do!

    Visit our Wish List Donate via Bitcoin
